Package kut

Class File

java.lang.Object
kut.File
public class File extends Object
File system management.

Paths must be writen in Linux-Unix format (in Windows inclusive).

      Returns the working directory.
      Returns:

    • copy

      public static void copy(String source, String target)
      Copy a file.

      NOTE: Target will be overwritte if already exists.

      Parameters:
      source - Can be a regular file or a directory.
      target -
      • If source is a directory, target must be a directory.
      • If source is a regular file, target can be a directory or a regular file.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If copy fails.

    • del

      public static void del(String path)
      Deletes 'path'.

      If 'path' is a directory, 'del' deletes it and all its subdirectories, although they are not empty.
      If 'path' does not exists, 'del' do nothing.

      Parameters:
      path - Path.

    • dir

      public static String[] dir(String path)
      Returns base names of files and directories of 'path'.
      Parameters:
      path - Path.
      Returns:
      List of file name.

      'true' if 'path' is a file, link or directory.

    • isRegular

      public static boolean isRegular(String path)
      Returns 'true' if 'path' is a regular file.

      NOTE: If 'path' is a link to a regular file, it returns 'true'.

      Parameters:
      path - Path.
      Returns:
      'true' if 'path' is a regular file.

    • mkdir

      public static void mkdir(String path)
      Creates the directory 'path' and its parent directories if is necessary.

      NOTE: If path already exists 'mkdir' do nothing.

      Parameters:
      path - Path

    • mklink

      Parameters:

      linkPath - Link path.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If 'mklink' fails.

      Throws:

    • readBytes

      public static byte[] readBytes(FileInputStream f, int buf)
      Reads 'buf' bytes of 'f'.

      When 'f' is at end, returns a bytes with no element.

      NOTE: 'f' was open with 'rbopen'.

      Parameters:
      f - Open file.
      buf - Bytes number to read.
      Returns:
      Bytes read.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the function fails.

    • readLine

      public static Opt<String> readLine(BufferedReader f)
      Returns the next line read from a 'UTF-8' text file 'f' or 'Opt.none' if there are no more lines to read.

      NOTE: 'f' was open with 'ropen'.

      Parameters:
      f - Open file.
      Returns:
      Line without line feed or carriage return.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the function fails.

    • rename

      public static void rename(String source, String target)
      Ranames (changes) source to target.
      Parameters:
      source - Current path.
      target - New path.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the function fails.

      Returns:
      File open.

    • tm

      public static long tm(String path)
      Returns time of last modification of 'path'.
      Parameters:
      path - Path.
      Returns:
      Milliseconds since the epoch (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z)
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the function fails.

    • tmp

      public static String tmp(String dir, String fname)
      Returns a random name for a file in "dir" with the scheme 'fname' + "xxxxxxxx".

      The return is checked that does not match any existing file.

      If 'dir' is an empty string, the current directoy is used.

      Parameters:
      dir - Directory to get the name.
      fname - Start of filename (Can not contains slash [/]).
      Returns:
      A unic name.

    • tmp

      public static String tmp(String fname)
      Returns a random name for a file in the file temporary directory with the scheme 'fname' + "xxxxxxxx".

      The return is checked that does not match any existing file.

      Parameters:
      fname - Start of filename (Can not contains slash [/]).
      Returns:
      A unic name.

    • write

      public static void write(String path, String text)
      Writes UTF-8 'text' in 'path'.

      If 'path' exists, it is overwriten.

      Parameters:
      path - Path.
      text - Text to write.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the function fails.
